1876 
1877 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::read_var_names(ExodusVarType type)
1878 {
1879  switch (type)
1880  {
1881  case NODAL:
1882  this->read_var_names_impl("n", num_nodal_vars, nodal_var_names);
1883  break;
1884  case ELEMENTAL:
1885  this->read_var_names_impl("e", num_elem_vars, elem_var_names);
1886  break;
1887  case GLOBAL:
1888  this->read_var_names_impl("g", num_global_vars, global_var_names);
1889  break;
1890  case SIDESET:
1891  this->read_var_names_impl("s", num_sideset_vars, sideset_var_names);
1892  break;
1893  case NODESET:
1894  this->read_var_names_impl("m", num_nodeset_vars, nodeset_var_names);
1895  break;
1896  case ELEMSET:
1897  this->read_var_names_impl("t", num_elemset_vars, elemset_var_names);
1898  break;
1899  default:
1900  libmesh_error_msg("Unrecognized ExodusVarType " << type);
1901  }
1902 }
1903 
1904 
1905 
1906 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::read_var_names_impl(const char * var_type,
1907  int & count,
1908  std::vector<std::string> & result)
1909 {
1910  // First read and store the number of names we have
1911  ex_err = exII::ex_get_var_param(ex_id, var_type, &count);
1912  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error reading number of variables.");
1913 
1914  // Do nothing if no variables are detected
1915  if (count == 0)
1916  return;
1917 
1918  // Second read the actual names and convert them into a format we can use
1919  NamesData names_table(count, MAX_STR_LENGTH);
1920 
1921  ex_err = exII::ex_get_var_names(ex_id,
1922  var_type,
1923  count,
1924  names_table.get_char_star_star()
1925  );
1926  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error reading variable names!");
1927 
1928  if (verbose)
1929  {
1930  libMesh::out << "Read the variable(s) from the file:" << std::endl;
1931  for (int i=0; i<count; i++)
1932  libMesh::out << names_table.get_char_star(i) << std::endl;
1933  }
1934 
1935  // Allocate enough space for our variable name strings.
1936  result.resize(count);
1937 
1938  // Copy the char buffers into strings.
1939  for (int i=0; i<count; i++)
1940  result[i] = names_table.get_char_star(i); // calls string::op=(const char *)
1941 }
1942 
1943 
1944 
1945 
1946 void
1947 ExodusII_IO_Helper::write_var_names(ExodusVarType type,
1948  const std::vector<std::string> & names)
1949 {
1950  switch (type)
1951  {
1952  case NODAL:
1953  this->write_var_names_impl("n", num_nodal_vars, names);
1954  break;
1955  case ELEMENTAL:
1956  this->write_var_names_impl("e", num_elem_vars, names);
1957  break;
1958  case GLOBAL:
1959  this->write_var_names_impl("g", num_global_vars, names);
1960  break;
1961  case SIDESET:
1962  {
1963  // Note: calling this function *sets* num_sideset_vars to the
1964  // number of entries in the 'names' vector, num_sideset_vars
1965  // does not already need to be set before calling this.
1966  this->write_var_names_impl("s", num_sideset_vars, names);
1967  break;
1968  }
1969  case NODESET:
1970  {
1971  this->write_var_names_impl("m", num_nodeset_vars, names);
1972  break;
1973  }
1974  case ELEMSET:
1975  {
1976  this->write_var_names_impl("t", num_elemset_vars, names);
1977  break;
1978  }
1979  default:
1980  libmesh_error_msg("Unrecognized ExodusVarType " << type);
1981  }
1982 }
1983 
1984 
1985 
1986 void
1987 ExodusII_IO_Helper::write_var_names_impl(const char * var_type,
1988  int & count,
1989  const std::vector<std::string> & names)
1990 {
1991  // Update the count variable so that it's available to other parts of the class.
1992  count = cast_int<int>(names.size());
1993 
1994  // Write that number of variables to the file.
1995  ex_err = exII::ex_put_var_param(ex_id, var_type, count);
1996  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error setting number of vars.");
1997 
1998  // Nemesis doesn't like trying to write nodal variable names in
1999  // files with no nodes.
2000  if (!this->num_nodes)
2001  return;
2002 
2003  if (count > 0)
2004  {
2005  NamesData names_table(count, MAX_STR_LENGTH);
2006 
2007  // Store the input names in the format required by Exodus.
2008  for (int i=0; i != count; ++i)
2009  {
2010  if(names[i].length() > MAX_STR_LENGTH)
2011  libmesh_warning(
2012  "*** Warning, Exodus variable name \""
2013  << names[i] << "\" too long (max " << MAX_STR_LENGTH
2014  << " characters). Name will be truncated. ");
2015  names_table.push_back_entry(names[i]);
2016  }
2017 
2018  if (verbose)
2019  {
2020  libMesh::out << "Writing variable name(s) to file: " << std::endl;
2021  for (int i=0; i != count; ++i)
2022  libMesh::out << names_table.get_char_star(i) << std::endl;
2023  }
2024 
2025  ex_err = exII::ex_put_var_names(ex_id,
2026  var_type,
2027  count,
2028  names_table.get_char_star_star()
2029  );
2030 
2031  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing variable names.");
2032  }
2033 }
2034 
2035 
2036 
2037 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::read_elemental_var_values(std::string elemental_var_name,
2038  int time_step,
2039  std::map<dof_id_type, Real> & elem_var_value_map)
2040 {
2041  LOG_SCOPE("read_elemental_var_values()", "ExodusII_IO_Helper");
2042 
2043  this->read_var_names(ELEMENTAL);
2044 
2045  // See if we can find the variable we are looking for
2046  unsigned int var_index = 0;
2047  bool found = false;
2048 
2049  // Do a linear search for elem_var_name in elemental_var_names
2050  for (; var_index != elem_var_names.size(); ++var_index)
2051  if (elem_var_names[var_index] == elemental_var_name)
2052  {
2053  found = true;
2054  break;
2055  }
2056 
2057  if (!found)
2058  {
2059  libMesh::err << "Available variables: " << std::endl;
2060  for (const auto & var_name : elem_var_names)
2061  libMesh::err << var_name << std::endl;
2062 
2063  libmesh_error_msg("Unable to locate variable named: " << elemental_var_name);
2064  }
2065 
2066  // Sequential index which we can use to look up the element ID in the elem_num_map.
2067  unsigned ex_el_num = 0;
2068 
2069  // Element variable truth table
2070  std::vector<int> var_table(block_ids.size() * elem_var_names.size());
2071  exII::ex_get_truth_table(ex_id, exII::EX_ELEM_BLOCK, block_ids.size(), elem_var_names.size(), var_table.data());
2072 
2073  for (unsigned i=0; i<static_cast<unsigned>(num_elem_blk); i++)
2074  {
2075  ex_err = exII::ex_get_block(ex_id,
2076  exII::EX_ELEM_BLOCK,
2077  block_ids[i],
2078  /*elem_type=*/nullptr,
2079  &num_elem_this_blk,
2080  /*num_nodes_per_entry=*/nullptr,
2081  /*num_edges_per_entry=*/nullptr,
2082  /*num_faces_per_entry=*/nullptr,
2083  /*num_attr=*/nullptr);
2084  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error getting number of elements in block.");
2085 
2086  // If the current variable isn't active on this subdomain, advance
2087  // the index by the number of elements on this block and go to the
2088  // next loop iteration.
2089  if (!var_table[elem_var_names.size()*i + var_index])
2090  {
2091  ex_el_num += num_elem_this_blk;
2092  continue;
2093  }
2094 
2095  std::vector<Real> block_elem_var_values(num_elem_this_blk);
2096 
2097  ex_err = exII::ex_get_var
2098  (ex_id,
2099  time_step,
2100  exII::EX_ELEM_BLOCK,
2101  var_index+1,
2102  block_ids[i],
2103  num_elem_this_blk,
2104  MappedInputVector(block_elem_var_values, _single_precision).data());
2105  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error getting elemental values.");
2106 
2107  for (unsigned j=0; j<static_cast<unsigned>(num_elem_this_blk); j++)
2108  {
2109  // Use the elem_num_map to obtain the ID of this element in the Exodus file,
2110  // and remember to subtract 1 since libmesh is zero-based and Exodus is 1-based.
2111  unsigned mapped_elem_id = this->elem_num_map[ex_el_num] - 1;
2112 
2113  // Store the elemental value in the map.
2114  elem_var_value_map[mapped_elem_id] = block_elem_var_values[j];
2115 
2116  // Go to the next sequential element ID.
2117  ex_el_num++;
2118  }
2119  }
2120 }
2121 
2122 
2123 // For Writing Solutions
2124 
2125 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::create(std::string filename)
2126 {
2127  // If we're processor 0, always create the file.
2128  // If we running on all procs, e.g. as one of several Nemesis files, also
2129  // call create there.
2130  if ((this->processor_id() == 0) || (!_run_only_on_proc0))
2131  {
2132  int
2133  comp_ws = 0,
2134  io_ws = 0;
2135 
2136  if (_single_precision)
2137  {
2138  comp_ws = cast_int<int>(sizeof(float));
2139  io_ws = cast_int<int>(sizeof(float));
2140  }
2141  // Fall back on double precision when necessary since ExodusII
2142  // doesn't seem to support long double
2143  else
2144  {
2145  comp_ws = cast_int<int>
2146  (std::min(sizeof(Real), sizeof(double)));
2147  io_ws = cast_int<int>
2148  (std::min(sizeof(Real), sizeof(double)));
2149  }
2150 
2151  // By default we just open the Exodus file in "EX_CLOBBER" mode,
2152  // which, according to "ncdump -k", writes the file in "64-bit
2153  // offset" mode, which is a NETCDF3 file format.
2154  int mode = EX_CLOBBER;
2155 
2156  // If HDF5 is available, by default we will write Exodus files
2157  // in a more modern NETCDF4-compatible format. For this file
2158  // type, "ncdump -k" will report "netCDF-4".
2159 #ifdef LIBMESH_HAVE_HDF5
2160  if (this->_write_hdf5)
2161  {
2162  mode |= EX_NETCDF4;
2163  mode |= EX_NOCLASSIC;
2164  }
2165 #endif
2166 
2167  ex_id = exII::ex_create(filename.c_str(), mode, &comp_ws, &io_ws);
2168 
2169  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_id, "Error creating ExodusII/Nemesis mesh file.");
2170 
2171  if (verbose)
2172  libMesh::out << "File created successfully." << std::endl;
2173  }
2174 
2175  opened_for_writing = true;
2176  _opened_by_create = true;
2177  current_filename = filename;
2178 }
2179 
2180 
2181 
2182 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::initialize(std::string str_title, const MeshBase & mesh, bool use_discontinuous)
2183 {
2184  // The majority of this function only executes on processor 0, so any functions
2185  // which are collective, like n_active_elem() or n_edge_conds() must be called
2186  // before the processors' execution paths diverge.
2187  libmesh_parallel_only(mesh.comm());
2188 
2189  unsigned int n_active_elem = mesh.n_active_elem();
2190  const BoundaryInfo & bi = mesh.get_boundary_info();
2191  num_edge = bi.n_edge_conds();
2192 
2193  // We need to know about all processors' subdomains
2194  subdomain_id_type subdomain_id_end = 0;
2195  auto subdomain_map = build_subdomain_map(mesh, _add_sides, subdomain_id_end);
2196 
2197  num_elem = n_active_elem;
2198  num_nodes = 0;
2199 
2200  // If we're adding face elements they'll need copies of their nodes.
2201  // We also have to count of how many nodes (and gaps between nodes!)
2202  // are on each processor, to calculate offsets for any nodal data
2203  // writing later.
2204  _added_side_node_offsets.clear();
2205  if (_add_sides)
2206  {
2207  dof_id_type num_side_elem = 0;
2208  dof_id_type num_local_side_nodes = 0;
2209 
2210  for (const auto & elem : mesh.active_local_element_ptr_range())
2211  {
2212  for (auto s : elem->side_index_range())
2213  {
2214  if (EquationSystems::redundant_added_side(*elem,s))
2215  continue;
2216 
2217  num_side_elem++;
2218  num_local_side_nodes += elem->nodes_on_side(s).size();
2219  }
2220  }
2221 
2222  mesh.comm().sum(num_side_elem);
2223  num_elem += num_side_elem;
2224 
2225  mesh.comm().allgather(num_local_side_nodes, _added_side_node_offsets);
2226  const processor_id_type n_proc = mesh.n_processors();
2227  libmesh_assert_equal_to(n_proc, _added_side_node_offsets.size());
2228 
2229  for (auto p : make_range(n_proc-1))
2230  _added_side_node_offsets[p+1] += _added_side_node_offsets[p];
2231 
2232  num_nodes = _added_side_node_offsets[n_proc-1];
2233 
2234  dof_id_type n_local_nodes = cast_int<dof_id_type>
2235  (std::distance(mesh.local_nodes_begin(),
2236  mesh.local_nodes_end()));
2237  dof_id_type n_total_nodes = n_local_nodes;
2238  mesh.comm().sum(n_total_nodes);
2239 
2240  const dof_id_type max_nn = mesh.max_node_id();
2241  const dof_id_type n_gaps = max_nn - n_total_nodes;
2242  const dof_id_type gaps_per_processor = n_gaps / n_proc;
2243  const dof_id_type remainder_gaps = n_gaps % n_proc;
2244 
2245  n_local_nodes = n_local_nodes + // Actual nodes
2246  gaps_per_processor + // Our even share of gaps
2247  (mesh.processor_id() < remainder_gaps); // Leftovers
2248 
2249  mesh.comm().allgather(n_local_nodes, _true_node_offsets);
2250  for (auto p : make_range(n_proc-1))
2251  _true_node_offsets[p+1] += _true_node_offsets[p];
2252  libmesh_assert_equal_to(_true_node_offsets[n_proc-1], mesh.max_node_id());
2253  }
2254 
2255  // If _write_as_dimension is nonzero, use it to set num_dim in the Exodus file.
2256  if (_write_as_dimension)
2257  num_dim = _write_as_dimension;
2258  else if (_use_mesh_dimension_instead_of_spatial_dimension)
2259  num_dim = mesh.mesh_dimension();
2260  else
2261  num_dim = mesh.spatial_dimension();
2262 
2263  if ((_run_only_on_proc0) && (this->processor_id() != 0))
2264  return;
2265 
2266  if (!use_discontinuous)
2267  {
2268  // Don't rely on mesh.n_nodes() here. If ReplicatedMesh nodes
2269  // have been deleted without renumbering after, it will be
2270  // incorrect.
2271  num_nodes += cast_int<int>(std::distance(mesh.nodes_begin(),
2272  mesh.nodes_end()));
2273  }
2274  else
2275  {
2276  for (const auto & elem : mesh.active_element_ptr_range())
2277  num_nodes += elem->n_nodes();
2278  }
2279 
2280  std::set<boundary_id_type> unique_side_boundaries;
2281  std::vector<boundary_id_type> unique_node_boundaries;
2282 
2283  // Build set of unique sideset (+shellface) ids
2284  {
2285  // Start with "side" boundaries (i.e. of 3D elements)
2286  std::vector<boundary_id_type> side_boundaries;
2287  bi.build_side_boundary_ids(side_boundaries);
2288  unique_side_boundaries.insert(side_boundaries.begin(), side_boundaries.end());
2289 
2290  // Add shell face boundaries to the list of side boundaries, since ExodusII
2291  // treats these the same way.
2292  std::vector<boundary_id_type> shellface_boundaries;
2293  bi.build_shellface_boundary_ids(shellface_boundaries);
2294  unique_side_boundaries.insert(shellface_boundaries.begin(), shellface_boundaries.end());
2295 
2296  // Add any empty-but-named side boundary ids
2297  for (const auto & pr : bi.get_sideset_name_map())
2298  unique_side_boundaries.insert(pr.first);
2299  }
2300 
2301  // Build set of unique nodeset ids
2302  bi.build_node_boundary_ids(unique_node_boundaries);
2303  for (const auto & pair : bi.get_nodeset_name_map())
2304  {
2305  const boundary_id_type id = pair.first;
2306 
2307  if (std::find(unique_node_boundaries.begin(),
2308  unique_node_boundaries.end(), id)
2309  == unique_node_boundaries.end())
2310  unique_node_boundaries.push_back(id);
2311  }
2312 
2313  num_side_sets = cast_int<int>(unique_side_boundaries.size());
2314  num_node_sets = cast_int<int>(unique_node_boundaries.size());
2315 
2316  num_elem_blk = cast_int<int>(subdomain_map.size());
2317 
2318  if (str_title.size() > MAX_LINE_LENGTH)
2319  {
2320  libMesh::err << "Warning, Exodus files cannot have titles longer than "
2321  << MAX_LINE_LENGTH
2322  << " characters. Your title will be truncated."
2323  << std::endl;
2324  str_title.resize(MAX_LINE_LENGTH);
2325  }
2326 
2327  // Edge BCs are handled a bit differently than sidesets and nodesets.
2328  // They are written as separate "edge blocks", and then edge variables
2329  // can be defined on those blocks. That is, they are not written as
2330  // edge sets, since edge sets must refer to edges stored elsewhere.
2331  // We write a separate edge block for each unique boundary id that
2332  // we have.
2333  num_edge_blk = bi.get_edge_boundary_ids().size();
2334 
2335  // Check whether the Mesh Elems have an extra_integer called "elemset_code".
2336  // If so, this means that the mesh defines elemsets via the
2337  // extra_integers capability of Elems.
2338  if (mesh.has_elem_integer("elemset_code"))
2339  {
2340  // unsigned int elemset_index =
2341  // mesh.get_elem_integer_index("elemset_code");
2342 
2343  // Debugging
2344  // libMesh::out << "Mesh defines an elemset_code at index " << elemset_index << std::endl;
2345 
2346  // Store the number of elemsets in the exo file header.
2347  num_elem_sets = mesh.n_elemsets();
2348  }
2349 
2350  // Build an ex_init_params() structure that is to be passed to the
2351  // newer ex_put_init_ext() API. The new API will eventually allow us
2352  // to store edge and face data in the Exodus file.
2353  //
2354  // Notes:
2355  // * We use C++11 zero initialization syntax to make sure that all
2356  // members of the struct (including ones we aren't using) are
2357  // given sensible values.
2358  // * For the "title" field, we manually do a null-terminated string
2359  // copy since std::string does not null-terminate but it does
2360  // return the number of characters successfully copied.
2361  exII::ex_init_params params = {};
2362  params.title[str_title.copy(params.title, MAX_LINE_LENGTH)] = '\0';
2363  params.num_dim = num_dim;
2364  params.num_nodes = num_nodes;
2365  params.num_elem = num_elem;
2366  params.num_elem_blk = num_elem_blk;
2367  params.num_node_sets = num_node_sets;
2368  params.num_side_sets = num_side_sets;
2369  params.num_elem_sets = num_elem_sets;
2370  params.num_edge_blk = num_edge_blk;
2371  params.num_edge = num_edge;
2372 
2373  ex_err = exII::ex_put_init_ext(ex_id, &params);
2374  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error initializing new Exodus file.");
2375 }
2376 
2377 
2378 
2379 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::write_nodal_coordinates(const MeshBase & mesh, bool use_discontinuous)
2380 {
2381  if ((_run_only_on_proc0) && (this->processor_id() != 0))
2382  return;
2383 
2384  // Clear existing data from any previous calls.
2385  x.clear();
2386  y.clear();
2387  z.clear();
2388  node_num_map.clear();
2389 
2390  // Reserve space in the nodal coordinate vectors. num_nodes is
2391  // exact, this just allows us to do away with one potentially
2392  // error-inducing loop index.
2393  x.reserve(num_nodes);
2394  y.reserve(num_nodes);
2395  z.reserve(num_nodes);
2396 
2397  auto push_node = [this](const Point & p) {
2398  x.push_back(p(0) + _coordinate_offset(0));
2399 
2400 #if LIBMESH_DIM > 1
2401  y.push_back(p(1) + _coordinate_offset(1));
2402 #else
2403  y.push_back(0.);
2404 #endif
2405 #if LIBMESH_DIM > 2
2406  z.push_back(p(2) + _coordinate_offset(2));
2407 #else
2408  z.push_back(0.);
2409 #endif
2410  };
2411 
2412  // And in the node_num_map - since the nodes aren't organized in
2413  // blocks, libmesh will always write out the identity map
2414  // here... unless there has been some refinement and coarsening, or
2415  // node deletion without a corresponding call to contract(). You
2416  // need to write this any time there could be 'holes' in the node
2417  // numbering, so we write it every time.
2418 
2419  // Let's skip the node_num_map in the discontinuous and add_sides
2420  // cases, since we're effectively duplicating nodes for the sake of
2421  // discontinuous visualization, so it isn't clear how to deal with
2422  // node_num_map here. This means that writing meshes in such a way
2423  // won't work with element numberings that have id "holes".
2424 
2425  if (!use_discontinuous && !_add_sides)
2426  node_num_map.reserve(num_nodes);
2427 
2428  // Clear out any previously-mapped node IDs.
2429  libmesh_node_num_to_exodus.clear();
2430 
2431  if (!use_discontinuous)
2432  {
2433  for (const auto & node_ptr : mesh.node_ptr_range())
2434  {
2435  const Node & node = *node_ptr;
2436 
2437  push_node(node);
2438 
2439  // Fill in node_num_map entry with the proper (1-based) node
2440  // id, unless we're not going to be able to keep the map up
2441  // later.
2442  if (!_add_sides)
2443  node_num_map.push_back(node.id() + 1);
2444 
2445  // Also map the zero-based libmesh node id to the 1-based
2446  // Exodus ID it will be assigned (this is equivalent to the
2447  // current size of the x vector).
2448  libmesh_node_num_to_exodus[ cast_int<int>(node.id()) ] = cast_int<int>(x.size());
2449  }
2450  }
2451  else
2452  {
2453  for (const auto & elem : mesh.active_element_ptr_range())
2454  for (const Node & node : elem->node_ref_range())
2455  {
2456  push_node(node);
2457 
2458  // Let's skip the node_num_map in the discontinuous
2459  // case, since we're effectively duplicating nodes for
2460  // the sake of discontinuous visualization, so it isn't
2461  // clear how to deal with node_num_map here. This means
2462  // that writing discontinuous meshes won't work with
2463  // element numberings that have "holes".
2464  }
2465  }
2466 
2467  if (_add_sides)
2468  {
2469  // To match the numbering of parallel-generated nodal solutions
2470  // on fake side nodes, we need to loop through elements from
2471  // earlier ranks first.
2472  std::vector<std::vector<const Elem *>>
2473  elems_by_pid(mesh.n_processors());
2474 
2475  for (const auto & elem : mesh.active_element_ptr_range())
2476  elems_by_pid[elem->processor_id()].push_back(elem);
2477 
2478  for (auto p : index_range(elems_by_pid))
2479  for (const Elem * elem : elems_by_pid[p])
2480  for (auto s : elem->side_index_range())
2481  {
2482  if (EquationSystems::redundant_added_side(*elem,s))
2483  continue;
2484 
2485  const std::vector<unsigned int> side_nodes =
2486  elem->nodes_on_side(s);
2487 
2488  for (auto n : side_nodes)
2489  push_node(elem->point(n));
2490  }
2491 
2492  // Node num maps just don't make sense if we're adding a bunch
2493  // of visualization nodes that are independent copies of the
2494  // same libMesh node.
2495  node_num_map.clear();
2496  }
2497 
2498  ex_err = exII::ex_put_coord
2499  (ex_id,
2500  x.empty() ? nullptr : MappedOutputVector(x, _single_precision).data(),
2501  y.empty() ? nullptr : MappedOutputVector(y, _single_precision).data(),
2502  z.empty() ? nullptr : MappedOutputVector(z, _single_precision).data());
2503 
2504  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing coordinates to Exodus file.");
2505 
2506  if (!use_discontinuous && !_add_sides)
2507  {
2508  // Also write the (1-based) node_num_map to the file.
2509  ex_err = exII::ex_put_node_num_map(ex_id, node_num_map.data());
2510  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing node_num_map");
2511  }
2512 }
2513 
2514 
2515 
2516 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::write_elements(const MeshBase & mesh, bool use_discontinuous)
2517 {
2518  LOG_SCOPE("write_elements()", "ExodusII_IO_Helper");
2519 
2520  // Map from block ID to a vector of element IDs in that block. Element
2521  // IDs are now of type dof_id_type, subdomain IDs are of type subdomain_id_type.
2522  subdomain_id_type subdomain_id_end = 0;
2523  auto subdomain_map = build_subdomain_map(mesh, _add_sides, subdomain_id_end);
2524 
2525  if ((_run_only_on_proc0) && (this->processor_id() != 0))
2526  return;
2527 
2528  // element map vector
2529  num_elem_blk = cast_int<int>(subdomain_map.size());
2530  block_ids.resize(num_elem_blk);
2531 
2532  std::vector<int> elem_blk_id;
2533  std::vector<int> num_elem_this_blk_vec;
2534  std::vector<int> num_nodes_per_elem_vec;
2535  std::vector<int> num_edges_per_elem_vec;
2536  std::vector<int> num_faces_per_elem_vec;
2537  std::vector<int> num_attr_vec;
2538  NamesData elem_type_table(num_elem_blk, MAX_STR_LENGTH);
2539 
2540  // Note: It appears that there is a bug in exodusII::ex_put_name where
2541  // the index returned from the ex_id_lkup is erroneously used. For now
2542  // the work around is to use the alternative function ex_put_names, but
2543  // this function requires a char ** data structure.
2544  NamesData names_table(num_elem_blk, MAX_STR_LENGTH);
2545 
2546  num_elem = 0;
2547 
2548  // counter indexes into the block_ids vector
2549  unsigned int counter = 0;
2550  for (auto & [subdomain_id, element_id_vec] : subdomain_map)
2551  {
2552  block_ids[counter] = subdomain_id;
2553 
2554  const ElemType elem_t = (subdomain_id >= subdomain_id_end) ?
2555  ElemType(subdomain_id - subdomain_id_end) :
2556  mesh.elem_ref(element_id_vec[0]).type();
2557 
2558  if (subdomain_id >= subdomain_id_end)
2559  {
2560  libmesh_assert(_add_sides);
2561  libmesh_assert(element_id_vec.size() == 1);
2562  num_elem_this_blk_vec.push_back
2563  (cast_int<int>(element_id_vec[0]));
2564  names_table.push_back_entry
2565  (Utility::enum_to_string<ElemType>(elem_t));
2566  }
2567  else
2568  {
2569  libmesh_assert(!element_id_vec.empty());
2570  num_elem_this_blk_vec.push_back
2571  (cast_int<int>(element_id_vec.size()));
2572  names_table.push_back_entry
2573  (mesh.subdomain_name(subdomain_id));
2574  }
2575 
2576  num_elem += num_elem_this_blk_vec.back();
2577 
2578  // Use the first element in this block to get representative information.
2579  // Note that Exodus assumes all elements in a block are of the same type!
2580  // We are using that same assumption here!
2581  const auto & conv = get_conversion(elem_t);
2582  num_nodes_per_elem = Elem::type_to_n_nodes_map[elem_t];
2583 
2584  elem_blk_id.push_back(subdomain_id);
2585  elem_type_table.push_back_entry(conv.exodus_elem_type().c_str());
2586  num_nodes_per_elem_vec.push_back(num_nodes_per_elem);
2587  num_attr_vec.push_back(0); // we don't currently use elem block attributes.
2588  num_edges_per_elem_vec.push_back(0); // We don't currently store any edge blocks
2589  num_faces_per_elem_vec.push_back(0); // We don't currently store any face blocks
2590  ++counter;
2591  }
2592 
2593  elem_num_map.resize(num_elem);
2594  std::vector<int>::iterator curr_elem_map_end = elem_num_map.begin();
2595 
2596  // In the case of discontinuous plotting we initialize a map from
2597  // (element, node) pairs to the corresponding discontinuous node index.
2598  // This ordering must match the ordering used in write_nodal_coordinates.
2599  //
2600  // Note: This map takes the place of the libmesh_node_num_to_exodus map in
2601  // the discontinuous case.
2602  std::map<std::pair<dof_id_type, unsigned int>, dof_id_type> discontinuous_node_indices;
2603  dof_id_type node_counter = 1; // Exodus numbering is 1-based
2604  if (use_discontinuous)
2605  {
2606  for (const auto & elem : mesh.active_element_ptr_range())
2607  for (auto n : elem->node_index_range())
2608  discontinuous_node_indices[std::make_pair(elem->id(),n)] =
2609  node_counter++;
2610  }
2611  else
2612  node_counter = mesh.max_node_id() + 1; // Exodus numbering is 1-based
2613 
2614  if (_add_sides)
2615  {
2616  for (const Elem * elem : mesh.active_element_ptr_range())
2617  {
2618  // We'll use "past-the-end" indices to indicate side node
2619  // copies
2620  unsigned int local_node_index = elem->n_nodes();
2621 
2622  for (auto s : elem->side_index_range())
2623  {
2624  if (EquationSystems::redundant_added_side(*elem,s))
2625  continue;
2626 
2627  const std::vector<unsigned int> side_nodes =
2628  elem->nodes_on_side(s);
2629 
2630  for (auto n : index_range(side_nodes))
2631  {
2632  libmesh_ignore(n);
2633  discontinuous_node_indices
2634  [std::make_pair(elem->id(),local_node_index++)] =
2635  node_counter++;
2636  }
2637  }
2638  }
2639  }
2640 
2641  // Reference to the BoundaryInfo object for convenience.
2642  const BoundaryInfo & bi = mesh.get_boundary_info();
2643 
2644  // Build list of (elem, edge, id) triples
2645  std::vector<BoundaryInfo::BCTuple> edge_tuples = bi.build_edge_list();
2646 
2647  // Build the connectivity array for each edge block. The connectivity array
2648  // is a vector<int> with "num_edges * num_nodes_per_edge" entries. We write
2649  // the Exodus node numbers to the connectivity arrays so that they can
2650  // be used directly in the calls to exII::ex_put_conn() below. We also keep
2651  // track of the ElemType and the number of nodes for each boundary_id. All
2652  // edges with a given boundary_id must be of the same type.
2653  std::map<boundary_id_type, std::vector<int>> edge_id_to_conn;
2654  std::map<boundary_id_type, std::pair<ElemType, unsigned int>> edge_id_to_elem_type;
2655 
2656  std::unique_ptr<const Elem> edge;
2657  for (const auto & t : edge_tuples)
2658  {
2659  dof_id_type elem_id = std::get<0>(t);
2660  unsigned int edge_id = std::get<1>(t);
2661  boundary_id_type b_id = std::get<2>(t);
2662 
2663  // Build the edge in question
2664  mesh.elem_ptr(elem_id)->build_edge_ptr(edge, edge_id);
2665 
2666  // Error checking: make sure that all edges in this block are
2667  // the same geometric type.
2668  auto check_it = edge_id_to_elem_type.find(b_id);
2669 
2670  if (check_it == edge_id_to_elem_type.end())
2671  {
2672  // Keep track of the ElemType and number of nodes in this boundary id.
2673  edge_id_to_elem_type[b_id] = std::make_pair(edge->type(), edge->n_nodes());
2674  }
2675  else
2676  {
2677  // Make sure the existing data is consistent
2678  auto & val_pair = check_it->second;
2679  libmesh_error_msg_if(val_pair.first != edge->type() || val_pair.second != edge->n_nodes(),
2680  "All edges in a block must have same geometric type.");
2681  }
2682 
2683  // Get reference to the connectivity array for this block
2684  auto & conn = edge_id_to_conn[b_id];
2685 
2686  // For each node on the edge, look up the exodus node id and
2687  // store it in the conn array. Note: all edge types have
2688  // identity node mappings so we don't bother with Conversion
2689  // objects here.
2690  for (auto n : edge->node_index_range())
2691  {
2692  // We look up Exodus node numbers differently if we are
2693  // writing a discontinuous Exodus file.
2694  int exodus_node_id = -1;
2695 
2696  if (!use_discontinuous)
2697  {
2698  dof_id_type libmesh_node_id = edge->node_ptr(n)->id();
2699  exodus_node_id = libmesh_map_find
2700  (libmesh_node_num_to_exodus, cast_int<int>(libmesh_node_id));
2701  }
2702  else
2703  {
2704  // Get the node on the element containing this edge
2705  // which corresponds to edge node n. Then use that id to look up
2706  // the exodus_node_id in the discontinuous_node_indices map.
2707  unsigned int pn = mesh.elem_ptr(elem_id)->local_edge_node(edge_id, n);
2708  exodus_node_id = libmesh_map_find
2709  (discontinuous_node_indices, std::make_pair(elem_id, pn));
2710  }
2711 
2712  conn.push_back(exodus_node_id);
2713  }
2714  }
2715 
2716  // Make sure we have the same number of edge ids that we thought we would.
2717  libmesh_assert(static_cast<int>(edge_id_to_conn.size()) == num_edge_blk);
2718 
2719  // Build data structures describing edge blocks. This information must be
2720  // be passed to exII::ex_put_concat_all_blocks() at the same time as the
2721  // information about elem blocks.
2722  std::vector<int> edge_blk_id;
2723  NamesData edge_type_table(num_edge_blk, MAX_STR_LENGTH);
2724  std::vector<int> num_edge_this_blk_vec;
2725  std::vector<int> num_nodes_per_edge_vec;
2726  std::vector<int> num_attr_edge_vec;
2727 
2728  // We also build a data structure of edge block names which can
2729  // later be passed to exII::ex_put_names().
2730  NamesData edge_block_names_table(num_edge_blk, MAX_STR_LENGTH);
2731 
2732  // Note: We are going to use the edge **boundary** ids as **block** ids.
2733  for (const auto & pr : edge_id_to_conn)
2734  {
2735  // Store the edge block id in the array to be passed to Exodus.
2736  boundary_id_type id = pr.first;
2737  edge_blk_id.push_back(id);
2738 
2739  // Set Exodus element type and number of nodes for this edge block.
2740  const auto & elem_type_node_count = edge_id_to_elem_type[id];
2741  const auto & conv = get_conversion(elem_type_node_count.first);
2742  edge_type_table.push_back_entry(conv.exodus_type.c_str());
2743  num_nodes_per_edge_vec.push_back(elem_type_node_count.second);
2744 
2745  // The number of edges is the number of entries in the connectivity
2746  // array divided by the number of nodes per edge.
2747  num_edge_this_blk_vec.push_back(pr.second.size() / elem_type_node_count.second);
2748 
2749  // We don't store any attributes currently
2750  num_attr_edge_vec.push_back(0);
2751 
2752  // Store the name of this edge block
2753  edge_block_names_table.push_back_entry(bi.get_edgeset_name(id));
2754  }
2755 
2756  // Zero-initialize and then fill in an exII::ex_block_params struct
2757  // with the data we have collected. This new API replaces the old
2758  // exII::ex_put_concat_elem_block() API, and will eventually allow
2759  // us to also allocate space for edge/face blocks if desired.
2760  //
2761  // TODO: It seems like we should be able to take advantage of the
2762  // optimization where you set define_maps==1, but when I tried this
2763  // I got the error: "failed to find node map size". I think the
2764  // problem is that we need to first specify a nonzero number of
2765  // node/elem maps during the call to ex_put_init_ext() in order for
2766  // this to work correctly.
2767  exII::ex_block_params params = {};
2768 
2769  // Set pointers for information about elem blocks.
2770  params.elem_blk_id = elem_blk_id.data();
2771  params.elem_type = elem_type_table.get_char_star_star();
2772  params.num_elem_this_blk = num_elem_this_blk_vec.data();
2773  params.num_nodes_per_elem = num_nodes_per_elem_vec.data();
2774  params.num_edges_per_elem = num_edges_per_elem_vec.data();
2775  params.num_faces_per_elem = num_faces_per_elem_vec.data();
2776  params.num_attr_elem = num_attr_vec.data();
2777  params.define_maps = 0;
2778 
2779  // Set pointers to edge block information only if we actually have some.
2780  if (num_edge_blk)
2781  {
2782  params.edge_blk_id = edge_blk_id.data();
2783  params.edge_type = edge_type_table.get_char_star_star();
2784  params.num_edge_this_blk = num_edge_this_blk_vec.data();
2785  params.num_nodes_per_edge = num_nodes_per_edge_vec.data();
2786  params.num_attr_edge = num_attr_edge_vec.data();
2787  }
2788 
2789  ex_err = exII::ex_put_concat_all_blocks(ex_id, &params);
2790  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing element blocks.");
2791 
2792  // This counter is used to fill up the libmesh_elem_num_to_exodus map in the loop below.
2793  unsigned libmesh_elem_num_to_exodus_counter = 0;
2794 
2795  // We need these later if we're adding fake sides, but we don't need
2796  // to recalculate it.
2797  auto num_elem_this_blk_it = num_elem_this_blk_vec.begin();
2798  auto next_fake_id = mesh.max_elem_id() + 1; // 1-based numbering in Exodus
2799 
2800  for (auto & [subdomain_id, element_id_vec] : subdomain_map)
2801  {
2802  // Use the first element in the block to get representative
2803  // information for a "real" block. Note that Exodus assumes all
2804  // elements in a block are of the same type! We are using that
2805  // same assumption here!
2806  const ElemType elem_t = (subdomain_id >= subdomain_id_end) ?
2807  ElemType(subdomain_id - subdomain_id_end) :
2808  mesh.elem_ref(element_id_vec[0]).type();
2809 
2810  const auto & conv = get_conversion(elem_t);
2811  num_nodes_per_elem = Elem::type_to_n_nodes_map[elem_t];
2812 
2813  // If this is a *real* block, we just loop over vectors of
2814  // element ids to add.
2815  if (subdomain_id < subdomain_id_end)
2816  {
2817  connect.resize(element_id_vec.size()*num_nodes_per_elem);
2818 
2819  for (auto i : index_range(element_id_vec))
2820  {
2821  unsigned int elem_id = element_id_vec[i];
2822  libmesh_elem_num_to_exodus[elem_id] = ++libmesh_elem_num_to_exodus_counter; // 1-based indexing for Exodus
2823 
2824  const Elem & elem = mesh.elem_ref(elem_id);
2825 
2826  // We *might* be able to get away with writing mixed element
2827  // types which happen to have the same number of nodes, but
2828  // do we actually *want* to get away with that?
2829  // .) No visualization software would be able to handle it.
2830  // .) There'd be no way for us to read it back in reliably.
2831  // .) Even elements with the same number of nodes may have different connectivities (?)
2832 
2833  // This needs to be more than an assert so we don't fail
2834  // with a mysterious segfault while trying to write mixed
2835  // element meshes in optimized mode.
2836  libmesh_error_msg_if(elem.type() != conv.libmesh_elem_type(),
2837  "Error: Exodus requires all elements with a given subdomain ID to be the same type.\n"
2838  << "Can't write both "
2839  << Utility::enum_to_string(elem.type())
2840  << " and "
2841  << Utility::enum_to_string(conv.libmesh_elem_type())
2842  << " in the same block!");
2843 
2844  for (unsigned int j=0; j<static_cast<unsigned int>(num_nodes_per_elem); ++j)
2845  {
2846  unsigned int connect_index = cast_int<unsigned int>((i*num_nodes_per_elem)+j);
2847  unsigned elem_node_index = conv.get_inverse_node_map(j); // inverse node map is for writing.
2848  if (!use_discontinuous)
2849  {
2850  // The global id for the current node in libmesh.
2851  dof_id_type libmesh_node_id = elem.node_id(elem_node_index);
2852 
2853  // Write the Exodus global node id associated with
2854  // this libmesh node number to the connectivity
2855  // array, or throw an error if it's not found.
2856  connect[connect_index] =
2857  libmesh_map_find(libmesh_node_num_to_exodus,
2858  cast_int<int>(libmesh_node_id));
2859  }
2860  else
2861  {
2862  // Look up the (elem_id, elem_node_index) pair in the map.
2863  connect[connect_index] =
2864  libmesh_map_find(discontinuous_node_indices,
2865  std::make_pair(elem_id, elem_node_index));
2866  }
2867  }
2868  }
2869 
2870  // This transform command stores its result in a range that
2871  // begins at the third argument, so this command is adding
2872  // values to the elem_num_map vector starting from
2873  // curr_elem_map_end. Here we add 1 to each id to make a
2874  // 1-based exodus file.
2875  curr_elem_map_end = std::transform
2876  (element_id_vec.begin(),
2877  element_id_vec.end(),
2878  curr_elem_map_end,
2879  [](dof_id_type id){return id+1;});
2880  }
2881  // If this is a "fake" block of added sides, we build those as
2882  // we go.
2883  else
2884  {
2885  libmesh_assert(_add_sides);
2886 
2887  libmesh_assert(num_elem_this_blk_it != num_elem_this_blk_vec.end());
2888  num_elem_this_blk = *num_elem_this_blk_it;
2889 
2890  connect.resize(num_elem_this_blk*num_nodes_per_elem);
2891 
2892  std::size_t connect_index = 0;
2893  for (const auto & elem : mesh.active_element_ptr_range())
2894  {
2895  unsigned int local_node_index = elem->n_nodes();
2896 
2897  for (auto s : elem->side_index_range())
2898  {
2899  if (EquationSystems::redundant_added_side(*elem,s))
2900  continue;
2901 
2902  if (elem->side_type(s) != elem_t)
2903  continue;
2904 
2905  const std::vector<unsigned int> side_nodes =
2906  elem->nodes_on_side(s);
2907 
2908  for (auto n : index_range(side_nodes))
2909  {
2910  libmesh_ignore(n);
2911  const int exodus_node_id = libmesh_map_find
2912  (discontinuous_node_indices,
2913  std::make_pair(elem->id(), local_node_index++));
2914  libmesh_assert_less(connect_index, connect.size());
2915  connect[connect_index++] = exodus_node_id;
2916  }
2917  }
2918  }
2919 
2920  auto old_curr_map_end = curr_elem_map_end;
2921  curr_elem_map_end += num_elem_this_blk;
2922 
2923  std::generate
2924  (old_curr_map_end, curr_elem_map_end,
2925  [&next_fake_id](){return next_fake_id++;});
2926  }
2927 
2928  ++num_elem_this_blk_it;
2929 
2930  ex_err = exII::ex_put_conn
2931  (ex_id,
2932  exII::EX_ELEM_BLOCK,
2933  subdomain_id,
2934  connect.data(), // node_conn
2935  nullptr, // elem_edge_conn (unused)
2936  nullptr); // elem_face_conn (unused)
2937  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing element connectivities");
2938  }
2939 
2940  // write out the element number map that we created
2941  ex_err = exII::ex_put_elem_num_map(ex_id, elem_num_map.data());
2942  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing element map");
2943 
2944  // Write out the block names
2945  if (num_elem_blk > 0)
2946  {
2947  ex_err = exII::ex_put_names(ex_id, exII::EX_ELEM_BLOCK, names_table.get_char_star_star());
2948  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing element block names");
2949  }
2950 
2951  // Write out edge blocks if we have any
2952  for (const auto & pr : edge_id_to_conn)
2953  {
2954  ex_err = exII::ex_put_conn
2955  (ex_id,
2956  exII::EX_EDGE_BLOCK,
2957  pr.first,
2958  pr.second.data(), // node_conn
2959  nullptr, // elem_edge_conn (unused)
2960  nullptr); // elem_face_conn (unused)
2961  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing element connectivities");
2962  }
2963 
2964  // Write out the edge block names, if any.
2965  if (num_edge_blk > 0)
2966  {
2967  ex_err = exII::ex_put_names
2968  (ex_id,
2969  exII::EX_EDGE_BLOCK,
2970  edge_block_names_table.get_char_star_star());
2971  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing edge block names");
2972  }
2973 }

2977 
2978 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::write_sidesets(const MeshBase & mesh)
2979 {
2980  LOG_SCOPE("write_sidesets()", "ExodusII_IO_Helper");
2981 
2982  if ((_run_only_on_proc0) && (this->processor_id() != 0))
2983  return;
2984 
2985  // Maps from sideset id to lists of corresponding element ids and side ids
2986  std::map<int, std::vector<int>> elem_lists;
2987  std::map<int, std::vector<int>> side_lists;
2988  std::set<boundary_id_type> side_boundary_ids;
2989 
2990  {
2991  // Accumulate the vectors to pass into ex_put_side_set
2992  // build_side_lists() returns a vector of (elem, side, bc) tuples.
2993  for (const auto & t : mesh.get_boundary_info().build_side_list())
2994  {
2995  std::vector<const Elem *> family;
2996 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
2997 
3001  mesh.elem_ref(std::get<0>(t)).active_family_tree_by_side(family, std::get<1>(t), false);
3002 #else
3003  family.push_back(mesh.elem_ptr(std::get<0>(t)));
3004 #endif
3005 
3006  for (const auto & f : family)
3007  {
3008  const auto & conv = get_conversion(mesh.elem_ptr(f->id())->type());
3009 
3010  // Use the libmesh to exodus data structure map to get the proper sideset IDs
3011  // The data structure contains the "collapsed" contiguous ids
3012  elem_lists[std::get<2>(t)].push_back(libmesh_elem_num_to_exodus[f->id()]);
3013  side_lists[std::get<2>(t)].push_back(conv.get_inverse_side_map(std::get<1>(t)));
3014  }
3015  }
3016 
3017  std::vector<boundary_id_type> tmp;
3018  mesh.get_boundary_info().build_side_boundary_ids(tmp);
3019  side_boundary_ids.insert(tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
3020  }
3021 
3022  {
3023  // add data for shell faces, if needed
3024 
3025  // Accumulate the vectors to pass into ex_put_side_set
3026  for (const auto & t : mesh.get_boundary_info().build_shellface_list())
3027  {
3028  std::vector<const Elem *> family;
3029 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
3030 
3034  mesh.elem_ref(std::get<0>(t)).active_family_tree_by_side(family, std::get<1>(t), false);
3035 #else
3036  family.push_back(mesh.elem_ptr(std::get<0>(t)));
3037 #endif
3038 
3039  for (const auto & f : family)
3040  {
3041  const auto & conv = get_conversion(mesh.elem_ptr(f->id())->type());
3042 
3043  // Use the libmesh to exodus data structure map to get the proper sideset IDs
3044  // The data structure contains the "collapsed" contiguous ids
3045  elem_lists[std::get<2>(t)].push_back(libmesh_elem_num_to_exodus[f->id()]);
3046  side_lists[std::get<2>(t)].push_back(conv.get_inverse_shellface_map(std::get<1>(t)));
3047  }
3048  }
3049 
3050  std::vector<boundary_id_type> tmp;
3051  mesh.get_boundary_info().build_shellface_boundary_ids(tmp);
3052  side_boundary_ids.insert(tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
3053  }
3054 
3055  // Add any empty-but-named side boundary ids
3056  for (const auto & pr : mesh.get_boundary_info().get_sideset_name_map())
3057  side_boundary_ids.insert(pr.first);
3058 
3059  // Write out the sideset names, but only if there is something to write
3060  if (side_boundary_ids.size() > 0)
3061  {
3062  NamesData names_table(side_boundary_ids.size(), MAX_STR_LENGTH);
3063 
3064  std::vector<exII::ex_set> sets(side_boundary_ids.size());
3065 
3066  // Loop over "side_boundary_ids" and "sets" simultaneously
3067  for (auto [i, it] = std::tuple{0u, side_boundary_ids.begin()}; i<sets.size(); ++i, ++it)
3068  {
3069  boundary_id_type ss_id = *it;
3070  names_table.push_back_entry(mesh.get_boundary_info().get_sideset_name(ss_id));
3071 
3072  sets[i].id = ss_id;
3073  sets[i].type = exII::EX_SIDE_SET;
3074  sets[i].num_distribution_factor = 0;
3075  sets[i].distribution_factor_list = nullptr;
3076 
3077  auto elem_it = elem_lists.find(ss_id);
3078  if (elem_it == elem_lists.end())
3079  {
3080  sets[i].num_entry = 0;
3081  sets[i].entry_list = nullptr;
3082  sets[i].extra_list = nullptr;
3083  }
3084  else
3085  {
3086  sets[i].num_entry = elem_it->second.size();
3087  sets[i].entry_list = elem_it->second.data();
3088  sets[i].extra_list = libmesh_map_find(side_lists, ss_id).data();
3089  }
3090  }
3091 
3092  ex_err = exII::ex_put_sets(ex_id, side_boundary_ids.size(), sets.data());
3093  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing sidesets");
3094 
3095  ex_err = exII::ex_put_names(ex_id, exII::EX_SIDE_SET, names_table.get_char_star_star());
3096  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing sideset names");
3097  }
3098 }

3101 
3102 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::write_nodesets(const MeshBase & mesh)
3103 {
3104  LOG_SCOPE("write_nodesets()", "ExodusII_IO_Helper");
3105 
3106  if ((_run_only_on_proc0) && (this->processor_id() != 0))
3107  return;
3108 
3109  // build_node_list() builds a sorted list of (node-id, bc-id) tuples
3110  // that is sorted by node-id, but we actually want it to be sorted
3111  // by bc-id, i.e. the second argument of the tuple.
3112  auto bc_tuples =
3113  mesh.get_boundary_info().build_node_list();
3114 
3115  // We use std::stable_sort() here so that the entries within a
3116  // single nodeset remain sorted in node-id order, but now the
3117  // smallest boundary id's nodes appear first in the list, followed
3118  // by the second smallest, etc. That is, we are purposely doing two
3119  // different sorts here, with the first one being within the
3120  // build_node_list() call itself.
3121  std::stable_sort(bc_tuples.begin(), bc_tuples.end(),
3122  [](const BoundaryInfo::NodeBCTuple & t1,
3123  const BoundaryInfo::NodeBCTuple & t2)
3124  { return std::get<1>(t1) < std::get<1>(t2); });
3125 
3126  std::vector<boundary_id_type> node_boundary_ids;
3127  mesh.get_boundary_info().build_node_boundary_ids(node_boundary_ids);
3128 
3129  // Add any empty-but-named node boundary ids
3130  for (const auto & pair : mesh.get_boundary_info().get_nodeset_name_map())
3131  {
3132  const boundary_id_type id = pair.first;
3133 
3134  if (std::find(node_boundary_ids.begin(),
3135  node_boundary_ids.end(), id)
3136  == node_boundary_ids.end())
3137  node_boundary_ids.push_back(id);
3138  }
3139 
3140  // Write out the nodeset names, but only if there is something to write
3141  if (node_boundary_ids.size() > 0)
3142  {
3143  NamesData names_table(node_boundary_ids.size(), MAX_STR_LENGTH);
3144 
3145  // Vectors to be filled and passed to exII::ex_put_concat_sets()
3146  // Use existing class members and avoid variable shadowing.
3147  nodeset_ids.clear();
3148  num_nodes_per_set.clear();
3149  num_node_df_per_set.clear();
3150  node_sets_node_index.clear();
3151  node_sets_node_list.clear();
3152 
3153  // Pre-allocate space
3154  nodeset_ids.reserve(node_boundary_ids.size());
3155  num_nodes_per_set.reserve(node_boundary_ids.size());
3156  num_node_df_per_set.resize(node_boundary_ids.size()); // all zeros
3157  node_sets_node_index.reserve(node_boundary_ids.size());
3158  node_sets_node_list.reserve(bc_tuples.size());
3159 
3160  // Assign entries to node_sets_node_list, keeping track of counts as we go.
3161  std::map<boundary_id_type, unsigned int> nodeset_counts;
3162  for (auto id : node_boundary_ids)
3163  nodeset_counts[id] = 0;
3164 
3165  for (const auto & t : bc_tuples)
3166  {
3167  const dof_id_type & node_id = std::get<0>(t) + 1; // Note: we use 1-based node ids in Exodus!
3168  const boundary_id_type & nodeset_id = std::get<1>(t);
3169  node_sets_node_list.push_back(node_id);
3170  nodeset_counts[nodeset_id] += 1;
3171  }
3172 
3173  // Fill in other indexing vectors needed by Exodus
3174  unsigned int running_sum = 0;
3175  for (const auto & pr : nodeset_counts)
3176  {
3177  nodeset_ids.push_back(pr.first);
3178  num_nodes_per_set.push_back(pr.second);
3179  node_sets_node_index.push_back(running_sum);
3180  names_table.push_back_entry(mesh.get_boundary_info().get_nodeset_name(pr.first));
3181  running_sum += pr.second;
3182  }
3183 
3184  // Fill in an exII::ex_set_specs object which can then be passed to
3185  // the ex_put_concat_sets() function.
3186  exII::ex_set_specs set_data = {};
3187  set_data.sets_ids = nodeset_ids.data();
3188  set_data.num_entries_per_set = num_nodes_per_set.data();
3189  set_data.num_dist_per_set = num_node_df_per_set.data(); // zeros
3190  set_data.sets_entry_index = node_sets_node_index.data();
3191  set_data.sets_dist_index = node_sets_node_index.data(); // dummy value
3192  set_data.sets_entry_list = node_sets_node_list.data();
3193 
3194  // Write all nodesets together.
3195  ex_err = exII::ex_put_concat_sets(ex_id, exII::EX_NODE_SET, &set_data);
3196  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing concatenated nodesets");
3197 
3198  // Write out the nodeset names
3199  ex_err = exII::ex_put_names(ex_id, exII::EX_NODE_SET, names_table.get_char_star_star());
3200  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing nodeset names");
3201  }
3202 }

3205 
3206 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::initialize_element_variables(std::vector<std::string> names,
3207  const std::vector<std::set<subdomain_id_type>> & vars_active_subdomains)
3208 {
3209  if ((_run_only_on_proc0) && (this->processor_id() != 0))
3210  return;
3211 
3212  // Quick return if there are no element variables to write
3213  if (names.size() == 0)
3214  return;
3215 
3216  // Be sure that variables in the file match what we are asking for
3217  if (num_elem_vars > 0)
3218  {
3219  this->check_existing_vars(ELEMENTAL, names, this->elem_var_names);
3220  return;
3221  }
3222 
3223  // Quick return if we have already called this function
3224  if (_elem_vars_initialized)
3225  return;
3226 
3227  // Set the flag so we can skip this stuff on subsequent calls to
3228  // initialize_element_variables()
3229  _elem_vars_initialized = true;
3230 
3231  this->write_var_names(ELEMENTAL, names);
3232 
3233  // Use the truth table to indicate which subdomain/variable pairs are
3234  // active according to vars_active_subdomains.
3235  std::vector<int> truth_tab(num_elem_blk*num_elem_vars, 0);
3236  for (auto var_num : index_range(vars_active_subdomains))
3237  {
3238  // If the list of active subdomains is empty, it is interpreted as being
3239  // active on *all* subdomains.
3240  std::set<subdomain_id_type> current_set;
3241  if (vars_active_subdomains[var_num].empty())
3242  for (auto block_id : block_ids)
3243  current_set.insert(cast_int<subdomain_id_type>(block_id));
3244  else
3245  current_set = vars_active_subdomains[var_num];
3246 
3247  // Find index into the truth table for each id in current_set.
3248  for (auto block_id : current_set)
3249  {
3250  auto it = std::find(block_ids.begin(), block_ids.end(), block_id);
3251  libmesh_error_msg_if(it == block_ids.end(),
3252  "ExodusII_IO_Helper: block id " << block_id << " not found in block_ids.");
3253 
3254  std::size_t block_index =
3255  std::distance(block_ids.begin(), it);
3256 
3257  std::size_t truth_tab_index = block_index*num_elem_vars + var_num;
3258  truth_tab[truth_tab_index] = 1;
3259  }
3260  }
3261 
3262  ex_err = exII::ex_put_truth_table
3263  (ex_id,
3264  exII::EX_ELEM_BLOCK,
3265  num_elem_blk,
3266  num_elem_vars,
3267  truth_tab.data());
3268  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing element truth table.");
3269 }

3326 
3327 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::check_existing_vars(ExodusVarType type,
3328  std::vector<std::string> & names,
3329  std::vector<std::string> & names_from_file)
3330 {
3331  // There may already be global variables in the file (for example,
3332  // if we're appending) and in that case, we
3333  // 1.) Cannot initialize them again.
3334  // 2.) Should check to be sure that the global variable names are the same.
3335 
3336  // Fills up names_from_file for us
3337  this->read_var_names(type);
3338 
3339  // Both the number of variables and their names (up to the first
3340  // MAX_STR_LENGTH characters) must match for the names we are
3341  // planning to write and the names already in the file.
3342  bool match =
3343  std::equal(names.begin(), names.end(),
3344  names_from_file.begin(),
3345  [](const std::string & a,
3346  const std::string & b) -> bool
3347  {
3348  return a.compare(/*pos=*/0, /*len=*/MAX_STR_LENGTH, b) == 0;
3349  });
3350 
3351  if (!match)
3352  {
3353  libMesh::err << "Error! The Exodus file already contains the variables:" << std::endl;
3354  for (const auto & name : names_from_file)
3355  libMesh::err << name << std::endl;
3356 
3357  libMesh::err << "And you asked to write:" << std::endl;
3358  for (const auto & name : names)
3359  libMesh::err << name << std::endl;
3360 
3361  libmesh_error_msg("Cannot overwrite existing variables in Exodus II file.");
3362  }
3363 }

3367 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::write_timestep(int timestep, Real time)
3368 {
3369  if ((_run_only_on_proc0) && (this->processor_id() != 0))
3370  return;
3371 
3372  if (_single_precision)
3373  {
3374  float cast_time = float(time);
3375  ex_err = exII::ex_put_time(ex_id, timestep, &cast_time);
3376  }
3377  else
3378  {
3379  double cast_time = double(time);
3380  ex_err = exII::ex_put_time(ex_id, timestep, &cast_time);
3381  }
3382  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing timestep.");
3383 
3384  this->update();
3385 }

3388 
3389 void
3390 ExodusII_IO_Helper::write_elemsets(const MeshBase & mesh)
3391 {
3392  LOG_SCOPE("write_elemsets()", "ExodusII_IO_Helper");
3393 
3394  if ((_run_only_on_proc0) && (this->processor_id() != 0))
3395  return;
3396 
3397  // TODO: Add support for named elemsets
3398  // NamesData names_table(elemsets.size(), MAX_STR_LENGTH);
3399 
3400  // We only need to write elemsets if the Mesh has an extra elem
3401  // integer called "elemset_code" defined on it.
3402  if (mesh.has_elem_integer("elemset_code"))
3403  {
3404  std::map<elemset_id_type, std::vector<int>> exodus_elemsets;
3405 
3406  unsigned int elemset_index =
3407  mesh.get_elem_integer_index("elemset_code");
3408 
3409  // Catch ids returned from MeshBase::get_elemsets() calls
3410  MeshBase::elemset_type set_ids;
3411  for (const auto & elem : mesh.element_ptr_range())
3412  {
3413  dof_id_type elemset_code =
3414  elem->get_extra_integer(elemset_index);
3415 
3416  // Look up which element set ids (if any) this elemset_code corresponds to.
3417  mesh.get_elemsets(elemset_code, set_ids);
3418 
3419  // Debugging
3420  // libMesh::out << "elemset_code = " << elemset_code << std::endl;
3421  // for (const auto & set_id : set_ids)
3422  // libMesh::out << set_id << " ";
3423  // libMesh::out << std::endl;
3424 
3425  // Store this Elem id in every set to which it belongs.
3426  for (const auto & set_id : set_ids)
3427  exodus_elemsets[set_id].push_back(libmesh_elem_num_to_exodus[elem->id()]);
3428  }
3429 
3430  // Debugging: print contents of exodus_elemsets map
3431  // for (const auto & [set_id, elem_ids] : exodus_elemsets)
3432  // {
3433  // libMesh::out << "elemset " << set_id << ": ";
3434  // for (const auto & elem_id : elem_ids)
3435  // libMesh::out << elem_id << " ";
3436  // libMesh::out << std::endl;
3437  // }
3438 
3439  // Only continue if we actually had some elements in sets
3440  if (!exodus_elemsets.empty())
3441  {
3442  // Reserve space, loop over newly-created map, construct
3443  // exII::ex_set objects to be passed to exII::ex_put_sets(). Note:
3444  // we do non-const iteration since Exodus requires non-const pointers
3445  // to be passed to its APIs.
3446  std::vector<exII::ex_set> sets;
3447  sets.reserve(exodus_elemsets.size());
3448 
3449  for (auto & [elem_set_id, ids_vec] : exodus_elemsets)
3450  {
3451  // TODO: Add support for named elemsets
3452  // names_table.push_back_entry(mesh.get_elemset_name(elem_set_id));
3453 
3454  exII::ex_set & current_set = sets.emplace_back();
3455  current_set.id = elem_set_id;
3456  current_set.type = exII::EX_ELEM_SET;
3457  current_set.num_entry = ids_vec.size();
3458  current_set.num_distribution_factor = 0;
3459  current_set.entry_list = ids_vec.data();
3460  current_set.extra_list = nullptr; // extra_list is used for sidesets, not needed for elemsets
3461  current_set.distribution_factor_list = nullptr; // not used for elemsets
3462  }
3463 
3464  // Sanity check: make sure the number of elemsets we already wrote to the header
3465  // matches the number of elemsets we just constructed by looping over the Mesh.
3466  libmesh_assert_msg(num_elem_sets == cast_int<int>(exodus_elemsets.size()),
3467  "Mesh has " << exodus_elemsets.size()
3468  << " elemsets, but header was written with num_elem_sets == " << num_elem_sets);
3469  libmesh_assert_msg(num_elem_sets == cast_int<int>(mesh.n_elemsets()),
3470  "mesh.n_elemsets() == " << mesh.n_elemsets()
3471  << ", but header was written with num_elem_sets == " << num_elem_sets);
3472 
3473  ex_err = exII::ex_put_sets(ex_id, exodus_elemsets.size(), sets.data());
3474  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing elemsets");
3475 
3476  // TODO: Add support for named elemsets
3477  // ex_err = exII::ex_put_names(ex_id, exII::EX_ELEM_SET, names_table.get_char_star_star());
3478  // EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing elemset names");
3479  } // end if (!exodus_elemsets.empty())
3480  } // end if (mesh.has_elem_integer("elemset_code"))
3481 }
3482 
3483 
3484 
3485 void
3486 ExodusII_IO_Helper::
3487 write_sideset_data(const MeshBase & mesh,
3488  int timestep,
3489  const std::vector<std::string> & var_names,
3490  const std::vector<std::set<boundary_id_type>> & side_ids,
3491  const std::vector<std::map<BoundaryInfo::BCTuple, Real>> & bc_vals)
3492 {
3493  LOG_SCOPE("write_sideset_data()", "ExodusII_IO_Helper");
3494 
3495  if ((_run_only_on_proc0) && (this->processor_id() != 0))
3496  return;
3497 
3498  // Write the sideset variable names to file. This function should
3499  // only be called once for SIDESET variables, repeated calls to
3500  // write_var_names overwrites/changes the order of names that were
3501  // there previously, and will mess up any data that has already been
3502  // written.
3503  this->write_var_names(SIDESET, var_names);
3504 
3505  // I hope that we are allowed to call read_sideset_info() even
3506  // though we are in the middle of writing? It seems to work provided
3507  // that you have already written the mesh itself... read_sideset_info()
3508  // fills in the following data members:
3509  // .) num_side_sets
3510  // .) ss_ids
3511  this->read_sideset_info();
3512 
3513  // Write "truth" table for sideset variables. The function
3514  // exII::ex_put_variable_param() must be called before
3515  // exII::ex_put_truth_table(). For us, this happens during the call
3516  // to ExodusII_IO_Helper::write_var_names(). sset_var_tab is a logically
3517  // (num_side_sets x num_sset_var) integer array of 0s and 1s
3518  // indicating which sidesets a given sideset variable is defined on.
3519  std::vector<int> sset_var_tab(num_side_sets * var_names.size());
3520 
3521  // We now call read_sideset() once per sideset and write any sideset
3522  // variable values which are defined there.
3523  int offset=0;
3524  for (int ss=0; ss<num_side_sets; ++ss)
3525  {
3526  // We don't know num_sides_per_set for each set until we call
3527  // read_sideset(). The values for each sideset are stored (using
3528  // the offsets) into the 'elem_list' and 'side_list' arrays of
3529  // this class.
3530  offset += (ss > 0 ? num_sides_per_set[ss-1] : 0);
3531  this->read_sideset(ss, offset);
3532 
3533  // For each variable in var_names, write the values for the
3534  // current sideset, if any.
3535  for (auto var : index_range(var_names))
3536  {
3537  // If this var has no values on this sideset, go to the next one.
3538  if (!side_ids[var].count(ss_ids[ss]))
3539  continue;
3540 
3541  // Otherwise, fill in this entry of the sideset truth table.
3542  sset_var_tab[ss*var_names.size() + var] = 1;
3543 
3544  // Data vector that will eventually be passed to exII::ex_put_var().
3545  std::vector<Real> sset_var_vals(num_sides_per_set[ss]);
3546 
3547  // Get reference to the BCTuple -> Real map for this variable.
3548  const auto & data_map = bc_vals[var];
3549 
3550  // Loop over elem_list, side_list entries in current sideset.
3551  for (int i=0; i<num_sides_per_set[ss]; ++i)
3552  {
3553  // Get elem_id and side_id from the respective lists that
3554  // are filled in by calling read_sideset().
3555  //
3556  // Note: these are Exodus-specific ids, so we have to convert them
3557  // to libmesh ids, as that is what will be in the bc_tuples.
3558  //
3559  // TODO: we should probably consult the exodus_elem_num_to_libmesh
3560  // mapping in order to figure out which libmesh element id 'elem_id'
3561  // actually corresponds to here, instead of just assuming it will be
3562  // off by one. Unfortunately that data structure does not seem to
3563  // be used at the moment. If we assume that write_sideset_data() is
3564  // always called following write(), then this should be a fairly safe
3565  // assumption...
3566  dof_id_type elem_id = elem_list[i + offset] - 1;
3567  unsigned int side_id = side_list[i + offset] - 1;
3568 
3569  // Sanity check: make sure that the "off by one"
3570  // assumption we used above to set 'elem_id' is valid.
3571  libmesh_error_msg_if
3572  (libmesh_map_find(libmesh_elem_num_to_exodus, cast_int<int>(elem_id)) !=
3573  cast_int<dof_id_type>(elem_list[i + offset]),
3574  "Error mapping Exodus elem id to libmesh elem id.");
3575 
3576  // Map from Exodus side ids to libmesh side ids.
3577  const auto & conv = get_conversion(mesh.elem_ptr(elem_id)->type());
3578 
3579  // Map from Exodus side ids to libmesh side ids.
3580  unsigned int converted_side_id = conv.get_side_map(side_id);
3581 
3582  // Construct a key so we can quickly see whether there is any
3583  // data for this variable in the map.
3584  BoundaryInfo::BCTuple key = std::make_tuple
3585  (elem_id,
3586  converted_side_id,
3587  ss_ids[ss]);
3588 
3589  // Find the data for this (elem,side,id) tuple. Throw an
3590  // error if not found. Then store value in vector which
3591  // will be passed to Exodus.
3592  sset_var_vals[i] = libmesh_map_find(data_map, key);
3593  } // end for (i)
3594 
3595  // As far as I can tell, there is no "concat" version of writing
3596  // sideset data, you have to call ex_put_sset_var() once per (variable,
3597  // sideset) pair.
3598  if (sset_var_vals.size() > 0)
3599  {
3600  ex_err = exII::ex_put_var
3601  (ex_id,
3602  timestep,
3603  exII::EX_SIDE_SET,
3604  var + 1, // 1-based variable index of current variable
3605  ss_ids[ss],
3606  num_sides_per_set[ss],
3607  MappedOutputVector(sset_var_vals, _single_precision).data());
3608  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing sideset vars.");
3609  }
3610  } // end for (var)
3611  } // end for (ss)
3612 
3613  // Finally, write the sideset truth table.
3614  ex_err =
3615  exII::ex_put_truth_table(ex_id,
3616  exII::EX_SIDE_SET,
3617  num_side_sets,
3618  cast_int<int>(var_names.size()),
3619  sset_var_tab.data());
3620  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing sideset var truth table.");
3621 }
3622 
3623 
3624 
3625 void
3626 ExodusII_IO_Helper::
3627 read_sideset_data(const MeshBase & mesh,
3628  int timestep,
3629  std::vector<std::string> & var_names,
3630  std::vector<std::set<boundary_id_type>> & side_ids,
3631  std::vector<std::map<BoundaryInfo::BCTuple, Real>> & bc_vals)
3632 {
3633  LOG_SCOPE("read_sideset_data()", "ExodusII_IO_Helper");
3634 
3635  // This reads the sideset variable names into the local
3636  // sideset_var_names data structure.
3637  this->read_var_names(SIDESET);
3638 
3639  if (num_sideset_vars)
3640  {
3641  // Read the sideset data truth table
3642  std::vector<int> sset_var_tab(num_side_sets * num_sideset_vars);
3643  ex_err = exII::ex_get_truth_table
3644  (ex_id,
3645  exII::EX_SIDE_SET,
3646  num_side_sets,
3647  num_sideset_vars,
3648  sset_var_tab.data());
3649  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error reading sideset variable truth table.");
3650 
3651  // Set up/allocate space in incoming data structures.
3652  var_names = sideset_var_names;
3653  side_ids.resize(num_sideset_vars);
3654  bc_vals.resize(num_sideset_vars);
3655 
3656  // Read the sideset data.
3657  //
3658  // Note: we assume that read_sideset() has already been called
3659  // for each sideset, so the required values in elem_list and
3660  // side_list are already present.
3661  //
3662  // TODO: As a future optimization, we could read only the values
3663  // requested by the user by looking at the input parameter
3664  // var_names and checking whether it already has entries in
3665  // it. We could do the same thing with the input side_ids
3666  // container and only read values for requested sidesets.
3667  int offset=0;
3668  for (int ss=0; ss<num_side_sets; ++ss)
3669  {
3670  offset += (ss > 0 ? num_sides_per_set[ss-1] : 0);
3671  for (int var=0; var<num_sideset_vars; ++var)
3672  {
3673  int is_present = sset_var_tab[num_sideset_vars*ss + var];
3674 
3675  if (is_present)
3676  {
3677  // Record the fact that this variable is defined on this sideset.
3678  side_ids[var].insert(ss_ids[ss]);
3679 
3680  // Note: the assumption here is that a previous call
3681  // to this->read_sideset_info() has already set the
3682  // values of num_sides_per_set, so we just use those values here.
3683  std::vector<Real> sset_var_vals(num_sides_per_set[ss]);
3684  ex_err = exII::ex_get_var
3685  (ex_id,
3686  timestep,
3687  exII::EX_SIDE_SET,
3688  var + 1, // 1-based sideset variable index!
3689  ss_ids[ss],
3690  num_sides_per_set[ss],
3691  MappedInputVector(sset_var_vals, _single_precision).data());
3692  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error reading sideset variable.");
3693 
3694  for (int i=0; i<num_sides_per_set[ss]; ++i)
3695  {
3696  dof_id_type exodus_elem_id = elem_list[i + offset];
3697  unsigned int exodus_side_id = side_list[i + offset];
3698 
3699  // FIXME: We should use exodus_elem_num_to_libmesh for this,
3700  // but it apparently is never set up, so just
3701  // subtract 1 from the Exodus elem id.
3702  dof_id_type converted_elem_id = exodus_elem_id - 1;
3703 
3704  // Map Exodus side id to libmesh side id.
3705  // Map from Exodus side ids to libmesh side ids.
3706  const auto & conv = get_conversion(mesh.elem_ptr(converted_elem_id)->type());
3707 
3708  // Map from Exodus side id to libmesh side id.
3709  // Note: the mapping is defined on 0-based indices, so subtract
3710  // 1 before doing the mapping.
3711  unsigned int converted_side_id = conv.get_side_map(exodus_side_id - 1);
3712 
3713  // Make a BCTuple key from the converted information.
3714  BoundaryInfo::BCTuple key = std::make_tuple
3715  (converted_elem_id,
3716  converted_side_id,
3717  ss_ids[ss]);
3718 
3719  // Store (elem, side, b_id) tuples in bc_vals[var]
3720  bc_vals[var].emplace(key, sset_var_vals[i]);
3721  } // end for (i)
3722  } // end if (present)
3723  } // end for (var)
3724  } // end for (ss)
3725  } // end if (num_sideset_vars)
3726 }
3727 
3728 
3729 void
3730 ExodusII_IO_Helper::
3731 get_sideset_data_indices (const MeshBase & mesh,
3732  std::map<BoundaryInfo::BCTuple, unsigned int> & bc_array_indices)
3733 {
3734  // Clear any existing data, we are going to build this data structure from scratch
3735  bc_array_indices.clear();
3736 
3737  // Store the sideset data array indices.
3738  //
3739  // Note: we assume that read_sideset() has already been called
3740  // for each sideset, so the required values in elem_list and
3741  // side_list are already present.
3742  int offset=0;
3743  for (int ss=0; ss<num_side_sets; ++ss)
3744  {
3745  offset += (ss > 0 ? num_sides_per_set[ss-1] : 0);
3746  for (int i=0; i<num_sides_per_set[ss]; ++i)
3747  {
3748  dof_id_type exodus_elem_id = elem_list[i + offset];
3749  unsigned int exodus_side_id = side_list[i + offset];
3750 
3751  // FIXME: We should use exodus_elem_num_to_libmesh for this,
3752  // but it apparently is never set up, so just
3753  // subtract 1 from the Exodus elem id.
3754  dof_id_type converted_elem_id = exodus_elem_id - 1;
3755 
3756  // Conversion operator for this Elem type
3757  const auto & conv = get_conversion(mesh.elem_ptr(converted_elem_id)->type());
3758 
3759  // Map from Exodus side id to libmesh side id.
3760  // Note: the mapping is defined on 0-based indices, so subtract
3761  // 1 before doing the mapping.
3762  unsigned int converted_side_id = conv.get_side_map(exodus_side_id - 1);
3763 
3764  // Make a BCTuple key from the converted information.
3765  BoundaryInfo::BCTuple key = std::make_tuple
3766  (converted_elem_id,
3767  converted_side_id,
3768  ss_ids[ss]);
3769 
3770  // Store (elem, side, b_id) tuple with corresponding array index
3771  bc_array_indices.emplace(key, cast_int<unsigned int>(i));
3772  } // end for (i)
3773  } // end for (ss)
3774 }

3776 
3777 
3778 void ExodusII_IO_Helper::
3779 write_nodeset_data (int timestep,
3780  const std::vector<std::string> & var_names,
3781  const std::vector<std::set<boundary_id_type>> & node_boundary_ids,
3782  const std::vector<std::map<BoundaryInfo::NodeBCTuple, Real>> & bc_vals)
3783 {
3784  LOG_SCOPE("write_nodeset_data()", "ExodusII_IO_Helper");
3785 
3786  if ((_run_only_on_proc0) && (this->processor_id() != 0))
3787  return;
3788 
3789  // Write the nodeset variable names to file. This function should
3790  // only be called once for NODESET variables, repeated calls to
3791  // write_var_names() overwrites/changes the order of names that were
3792  // there previously, and will mess up any data that has already been
3793  // written.
3794  this->write_var_names(NODESET, var_names);
3795 
3796  // For all nodesets, reads and fills in the arrays:
3797  // nodeset_ids
3798  // num_nodes_per_set
3799  // node_sets_node_index - starting index for each nodeset in the node_sets_node_list vector
3800  // node_sets_node_list
3801  // Note: we need these arrays so that we know what data to write
3802  this->read_all_nodesets();
3803 
3804  // The "truth" table for nodeset variables. nset_var_tab is a
3805  // logically (num_node_sets x num_nset_var) integer array of 0s and
3806  // 1s indicating which nodesets a given nodeset variable is defined
3807  // on.
3808  std::vector<int> nset_var_tab(num_node_sets * var_names.size());
3809 
3810  for (int ns=0; ns<num_node_sets; ++ns)
3811  {
3812  // The offset into the node_sets_node_list for the current nodeset
3813  int offset = node_sets_node_index[ns];
3814 
3815  // For each variable in var_names, write the values for the
3816  // current nodeset, if any.
3817  for (auto var : index_range(var_names))
3818  {
3819  // If this var has no values on this nodeset, go to the next one.
3820  if (!node_boundary_ids[var].count(nodeset_ids[ns]))
3821  continue;
3822 
3823  // Otherwise, fill in this entry of the nodeset truth table.
3824  nset_var_tab[ns*var_names.size() + var] = 1;
3825 
3826  // Data vector that will eventually be passed to exII::ex_put_var().
3827  std::vector<Real> nset_var_vals(num_nodes_per_set[ns]);
3828 
3829  // Get reference to the NodeBCTuple -> Real map for this variable.
3830  const auto & data_map = bc_vals[var];
3831 
3832  // Loop over entries in current nodeset.
3833  for (int i=0; i<num_nodes_per_set[ns]; ++i)
3834  {
3835  // Here we convert Exodus node ids to libMesh node ids by
3836  // subtracting 1. We should probably use the
3837  // exodus_node_num_to_libmesh data structure for this, but
3838  // I don't think it is set up at the time when
3839  // write_nodeset_data() would normally be called.
3840  dof_id_type libmesh_node_id = node_sets_node_list[i + offset] - 1;
3841 
3842  // Construct a key to look up values in data_map.
3843  BoundaryInfo::NodeBCTuple key =
3844  std::make_tuple(libmesh_node_id, nodeset_ids[ns]);
3845 
3846  // We require that the user provided either no values for
3847  // this (var, nodeset) combination (in which case we don't
3848  // reach this point) or a value for _every_ node in this
3849  // nodeset for this var, so we use the libmesh_map_find()
3850  // macro to check for this.
3851  nset_var_vals[i] = libmesh_map_find(data_map, key);
3852  } // end for (node in nodeset[ns])
3853 
3854  // Write nodeset values to Exodus file
3855  if (nset_var_vals.size() > 0)
3856  {
3857  ex_err = exII::ex_put_var
3858  (ex_id,
3859  timestep,
3860  exII::EX_NODE_SET,
3861  var + 1, // 1-based variable index of current variable
3862  nodeset_ids[ns],
3863  num_nodes_per_set[ns],
3864  MappedOutputVector(nset_var_vals, _single_precision).data());
3865  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing nodeset vars.");
3866  }
3867  } // end for (var in var_names)
3868  } // end for (ns)
3869 
3870  // Finally, write the nodeset truth table.
3871  ex_err =
3872  exII::ex_put_truth_table(ex_id,
3873  exII::EX_NODE_SET,
3874  num_node_sets,
3875  cast_int<int>(var_names.size()),
3876  nset_var_tab.data());
3877  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing nodeset var truth table.");
3878 }
3879 
3880 
3881 
3882 void
3883 ExodusII_IO_Helper::
3884 write_elemset_data (int timestep,
3885  const std::vector<std::string> & var_names,
3886  const std::vector<std::set<elemset_id_type>> & elemset_ids_in,
3887  const std::vector<std::map<std::pair<dof_id_type, elemset_id_type>, Real>> & elemset_vals)
3888 {
3889  LOG_SCOPE("write_elemset_data()", "ExodusII_IO_Helper");
3890 
3891  if ((_run_only_on_proc0) && (this->processor_id() != 0))
3892  return;
3893 
3894  // Write the elemset variable names to file. This function should
3895  // only be called once for ELEMSET variables, repeated calls to
3896  // write_var_names() overwrites/changes the order of names that were
3897  // there previously, and will mess up any data that has already been
3898  // written.
3899  this->write_var_names(ELEMSET, var_names);
3900 
3901  // We now call the API to read the elemset info even though we are
3902  // in the middle of writing. This is a bit counter-intuitive, but it
3903  // seems to work provided that you have already written the mesh
3904  // itself... read_elemset_info() fills in the following data
3905  // members:
3906  // .) id_to_elemset_names
3907  // .) num_elems_per_set
3908  // .) num_elem_df_per_set
3909  // .) elemset_list
3910  // .) elemset_id_list
3911  // .) id_to_elemset_names
3912  this->read_elemset_info();
3913 
3914  // The "truth" table for elemset variables. elemset_var_tab is a
3915  // logically (num_elem_sets x num_elemset_vars) integer array of 0s and
3916  // 1s indicating which elemsets a given elemset variable is defined
3917  // on.
3918  std::vector<int> elemset_var_tab(num_elem_sets * var_names.size());
3919 
3920  int offset=0;
3921  for (int es=0; es<num_elem_sets; ++es)
3922  {
3923  // Debugging
3924  // libMesh::out << "Writing elemset variable values for elemset "
3925  // << es << ", elemset_id = " << elemset_ids[es]
3926  // << std::endl;
3927 
3928  // We know num_elems_per_set because we called read_elemset_info() above.
3929  offset += (es > 0 ? num_elems_per_set[es-1] : 0);
3930  this->read_elemset(es, offset);
3931 
3932  // For each variable in var_names, write the values for the
3933  // current elemset, if any.
3934  for (auto var : index_range(var_names))
3935  {
3936  // Debugging
3937  // libMesh::out << "Writing elemset variable values for var " << var << std::endl;
3938 
3939  // If this var has no values on this elemset, go to the next one.
3940  if (!elemset_ids_in[var].count(elemset_ids[es]))
3941  continue;
3942 
3943  // Otherwise, fill in this entry of the nodeset truth table.
3944  elemset_var_tab[es*var_names.size() + var] = 1;
3945 
3946  // Data vector that will eventually be passed to exII::ex_put_var().
3947  std::vector<Real> elemset_var_vals(num_elems_per_set[es]);
3948 
3949  // Get reference to the (elem_id, elemset_id) -> Real map for this variable.
3950  const auto & data_map = elemset_vals[var];
3951 
3952  // Loop over entries in current elemset.
3953  for (int i=0; i<num_elems_per_set[es]; ++i)
3954  {
3955  // Here we convert Exodus elem ids to libMesh node ids
3956  // simply by subtracting 1. We should probably use the
3957  // exodus_elem_num_to_libmesh data structure for this,
3958  // but I don't think it is set up at the time when this
3959  // function is normally called.
3960  dof_id_type libmesh_elem_id = elemset_list[i + offset] - 1;
3961 
3962  // Construct a key to look up values in data_map.
3963  std::pair<dof_id_type, elemset_id_type> key =
3964  std::make_pair(libmesh_elem_id, elemset_ids[es]);
3965 
3966  // Debugging:
3967  // libMesh::out << "Searching for key = (" << key.first << ", " << key.second << ")" << std::endl;
3968 
3969  // We require that the user provided either no values for
3970  // this (var, elemset) combination (in which case we don't
3971  // reach this point) or a value for _every_ elem in this
3972  // elemset for this var, so we use the libmesh_map_find()
3973  // macro to check for this.
3974  elemset_var_vals[i] = libmesh_map_find(data_map, key);
3975  } // end for (node in nodeset[ns])
3976 
3977  // Write elemset values to Exodus file
3978  if (elemset_var_vals.size() > 0)
3979  {
3980  ex_err = exII::ex_put_var
3981  (ex_id,
3982  timestep,
3983  exII::EX_ELEM_SET,
3984  var + 1, // 1-based variable index of current variable
3985  elemset_ids[es],
3986  num_elems_per_set[es],
3987  MappedOutputVector(elemset_var_vals, _single_precision).data());
3988  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing elemset vars.");
3989  }
3990  } // end for (var in var_names)
3991  } // end for (ns)
3992 
3993  // Finally, write the elemset truth table to file.
3994  ex_err =
3995  exII::ex_put_truth_table(ex_id,
3996  exII::EX_ELEM_SET, // exII::ex_entity_type
3997  num_elem_sets,
3998  cast_int<int>(var_names.size()),
3999  elemset_var_tab.data());
4000  EX_CHECK_ERR(ex_err, "Error writing elemset var truth table.");
4001 }
4002
